titleStmt.title: The free schoole of vvarre, or, A treatise, vvhether it be lawfull to beare armes for the seruice of a prince that is of a diuers religion
Quaestio quodlibetica. English
titleStmt.author: Sarpi, Paolo, 1552-1623.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A11511 of text S116734 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 21758). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 89 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 39 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The free schoole of vvarre, or, A treatise, vvhether it be lawfull to beare armes for the seruice of a prince that is of a diuers religion
Quaestio quodlibetica. English
titleStmt.author: Sarpi, Paolo, 1552-1623.
Bedell, William, 1571-1642.
Brent, Nathaniel, Sir, 1573?-1652.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iohn Bill, printer to the Kings most excellent Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: A translation by Sir Nathaniel Brent of an untraced work by Paolo Sarpi; the Latin translation was entitled: Quaestio quodlibetica.
Editor's note "To the reader" signed: W.B., i.e. William Bedell.
Some running titles read: The true schoole of warre.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.

keywords.term: War -- Religious aspects -- Early works to 1800.
